intro: Hibbertia caudice, commonly known as the warty hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, warty stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in heathland and woodland habitats. Hibbertia caudice is often found in coastal regions of South Australia and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
